trans-unit.source: Exposes a means of generating client proxy classes for XML Web services.
The interface to an XML Web service is typically described by a Web Services Description Language (WSDL) file.
For example, to obtain a WSDL description of a Web service using ASP.NET exposed at `http://localhost/service.asmx`, simply navigate to `http://localhost/service.asmx?WSDL`.

The <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescriptionImporter> class allows you to easily import the information contained in a WSDL description into a <xref:System.CodeDom.CodeCompileUnit?displayProperty=fullName> object.

By adjusting the value of the <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescriptionImporter.Style%2A> parameter, you can instruct a <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescriptionImporter> instance either to generate a client proxy class that provides the functionality of the Web service by transparently calling it or to generate an abstract class that encapsulates the functionality of the Web service without implementing it.
The code in the resulting <xref:System.CodeDom.CodeCompileUnit> object can then either be called directly or exported in the language of your choice.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescriptionImporter"></xref> class.

Adds the specified <xref href="System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescription"></xref> to the collection of <xref href="System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescriptionImporter.ServiceDescriptions"></xref> values to be imported.

Use this method to add <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescription> instances to the collection that is to be imported when the <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescriptionImporter.Import%2A> method is called.

The two string parameters, `appSettingUrlKey` and `appSettingBaseUrl`, specify how to construct the `Url` property of the XML Web service proxy that is to be generated from the imported <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescription> value.
The `appSettingUrlKey` parameter specifies that the `Url` property should be read out of the web.config file's `<appsettings>` section by using the parameter value as the configuration key.
If the `appSettingUrlKey` parameter is `null` or an empty string, the initial value is determined by the `location` attribute in the Web Services Description Language (WSDL) document.
If the value of <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescriptionImporter.Style%2A> is `Server`, an error is raised if you attempt to set the value of the `appSettingUrlKey` parameter.

The `appSettingBaseUrl` parameter specifies that the initial value for the `Url` property should be constructed from a combination of this parameter value and the URL specified by the `location` attribute in the WSDL document.
The `appSettingUrlKey` parameter must also be specified.
The `Url` property is constructed by combining a relative URL (constructed from the `appSettingBaseUrl` parameter and the WSDL-specified URL) with the URL loaded from the web.config file.
If this parameter is `null` or an empty string, the URL is constructed entirely from the value in the web.config file.
The <xref href="System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescription"></xref> instance to add to the collection
Sets the initial value of the `Url` property of the proxy class to be generated from the instance represented by the serviceDescription parameter.
Specifies that it should be generated from the web.config file's `<appsetting>` section.
Sets the initial value of the `Url` property of the proxy class to be generated from the instance represented by the serviceDescription parameter.
Specifies that it should be constructed from a combination of the value of this parameter and the URL specified by the `location` attribute in the WSDL document.
Gets or sets various options for code generation.

The <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescriptionImporter.CodeGenerationOptions%2A> property allows you to specify various options used when the <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescriptionImporter.Import%2A> method is called to generate code.

For example, you can specify whether simple types described in the WSDL are generated as value types or <xref:System.Data.SqlTypes> namespace types, and whether they are generated as properties or fields.
A member or combination of members of the <xref href="System.Xml.Serialization.CodeGenerationOptions"></xref> enumeration.
Gets or sets the code generator used by the service description importer.
The <xref href="System.CodeDom.Compiler.ICodeGenerator"></xref> interface used by the service description importer to generate proxy code.
Compiles a collection of Web references to produce a client proxy or a server stub.

The services description document collection in each <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.WebReference> member of the `webReferences` collection should contain only <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescription> and <xref:System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchema> objects.
This method is unable to interpret <xref:System.Web.Services.Discovery.DiscoveryDocument> objects.
If any of the XML Web service methods in the `webReferences` collection share custom parameter or return types, those types are also shared among the proxy methods generated.
This is an important advantage over the situation in which each proxy is compiled separately, because in that case such types do not interoperate.
A <xref href="System.Web.Services.Description.WebReferenceCollection"></xref> of Web references to compile.
A <xref href="System.CodeDom.Compiler.CodeDomProvider"></xref> that specifies the code provider.
A <xref href="System.CodeDom.CodeCompileUnit"></xref> that specifies the unit into which code is compiled.
A <xref href="System.Web.Services.Description.WebReferenceOptions"></xref> that specifies code generation options.
A <xref href="System.Collections.Specialized.StringCollection"></xref> of compiler warnings.

Imports the specified <xref href="System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescriptionImporter.ServiceDescriptions"></xref> values, that generates code as specified by the <xref href="System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescriptionImporter.Style"></xref> property.

After you have specified the <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescriptionImporter.ServiceDescriptions%2A> values to import and the <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescriptionImporter.Style%2A> property of the code to generate, call the <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.Import> method to initiate code generation.
The namespace into which the <xref href="System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescriptionImporter.ServiceDescriptions"></xref> values are imported.

The <xref href="System.CodeDom.CodeCompileUnit"></xref> instance in which the code that represents the <xref href="System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescriptionImporter.ServiceDescriptions"></xref> value is generated.
A <xref href="System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescriptionImportWarnings"></xref> value that describes any error that occurred; or 0 if no error occurred.
Gets or sets the protocol used to access the described XML Web services.
The allowed values of this property are:
"Soap"
"Soap12"
"HttpPost"
"HttpGet"
"HttpSoap"
The default value is "Soap", which indicates the SOAP 1.1 standard.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> that contains the case-insensitive name of the protocol to be imported.
Gets the <xref href="System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSchemas"></xref> used by the <xref href="System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescriptionImporter.ServiceDescriptions"></xref> property.

An <xref href="System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSchemas"></xref> object that contains the XML schemas used by the <xref href="System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescription"></xref> instances in the <xref href="System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescriptionImporter.ServiceDescriptions"></xref> collection.
Gets the collection of <xref href="System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescription"></xref> instances to be imported.
As with any collection that forms a read-only property, members can be added to the collection, removed from the collection, or modified using the methods exposed by the collection.
You can also use the <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescriptionImporter.AddServiceDescription%2A> method to add members to this collection.

A <xref href="System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescriptionCollection"></xref> instance that contains the <xref href="System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescription"></xref> instances slated to be imported by the <xref href="System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescriptionImporter"></xref> instance.

Gets or sets a value that determines the style of code (client or server) that is generated when the <xref href="System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescriptionImporter.ServiceDescriptions"></xref> values are imported.

If the <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescriptionImporter.Style%2A> property is set to <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescriptionImportStyle.Client>, the <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescriptionImporter> generates client proxy classes that provide the functionality of the described Web services by calling them.

If the <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescriptionImporter.Style%2A> property is set to <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescriptionImportStyle.Server>, the <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescriptionImporter> instance generates abstract classes that represent the functionality of the described XML Web services without implementing them.
You can then implement them by writing classes that inherit from these abstract classes and implement the relevant methods.
One of the <xref href="System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescriptionImportStyle"></xref> values.
The default is <xref href="System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescriptionImportStyle.Client"></xref>.
